column1: # Name: Do male and female spouses have equal inheritance rights to property?

# Definition: For the purpose of this question, it is assumed that the deceased spouse left no children or any other heirs, other than the surviving spouse;This question examines whether both spouses have equal rank and rights when it comes to inheriting assets in the absence of a will;The answer is “Yes” where the law recognizes the same rights to surviving spouses, once his or her spouse is deceased;The answer is “No” where there are gender-based differences on inheritance.
# Source: World Bank, Women Business and the Law
# Data from the No Ceilings project: http://noceilings.org
# For more about the data, please visit http://noceilings.org/data
